phoenix::PhEmitter

PhParticleSystem * partsys

Detailed Description

Abstract Particle Emitter.

This is an abstract base class for creating particle emitters that create particles to be added to the particle system.

See also:
PhParticle, PhParticleSystem

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

phoenix::PhEmitter::PhEmitter (  ) 

Constructor.

Default constructor, it sets partsys to NULL. In order for your emitter to work, you must add it to a particle system by calling PhParticleSystem::addEmiter() in your overloaded constructor.

virtual phoenix::PhEmitter::~PhEmitter (  )  [virtual]

Destructor.

The default destructor calls PhParticleSystem::removeEmitter() if partsys is not null. Please note that if you delete an instance of this class without removing it from the particle system you will get a segfault.

Member Function Documentation

virtual void phoenix::PhEmitter::step (  )  [virtual]

Step.

This function is called once every frame from PhParticleSystem::onPostRender(), this is where you put your code to create new particles.

See also:
PhParticleSystem::onPostRender()
